Dear Mr. ___,

I am writing to provide you with a summary of your recent hospital stay at [Your Hospital’s Name]. You were admitted on March 10, 2024, with symptoms of chest pain and shortness of breath, and were diagnosed with an ST elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) involving the left main coronary artery.

Upon your arrival in our emergency department, an electrocardiogram (ECG) revealed significant ST elevation in leads V5-6. This prompted immediate administration of MONAC treatment to address the acute symptoms and stabilize your condition. Your lab tests showed elevated levels of Troponin T, with results of 30 and 29 on consecutive tests dated March 11, 2024, which further confirmed the diagnosis of a myocardial infarction.

During your stay, you were prescribed several medications to manage your condition and alleviate symptoms. This included Morphine for pain relief, provided as needed; supplementary Oxygen therapy if your oxygen saturation fell below 90%; Nitroglycerin to be taken every five minutes for up to three doses should chest pain persist; and a single dosage of Aspirin, to be chewed for its antiplatelet effect.

Due to ongoing persistent ST elevation and the inability to promptly contact the catheterization laboratory and cardio team, more invasive procedures such as percutaneous coronary intervention (PCA) could not be carried out immediately. Nevertheless, your symptoms improved significantly during your stay. By the night of March 12, 2024, you reported a resolution of chest pain and requested to be discharged.

I recommend scheduling a follow-up appointment with your cardiologist to continue managing your heart health effectively. Please remember to adhere to any prescribed medication regimen and attend all subsequent appointments to monitor your condition closely.

Should you experience any recurrence of chest pain, difficulty breathing, or any other concerning symptoms, it is important to seek medical attention promptly.

Thank you for choosing [Your Hospital’s Name] for your healthcare needs. We wish you a smooth recovery. Should you have any questions or need further assistance, please do not hesitate to contact us.

Warm regards,

Dr. ___
